intro: Arthrophytum, commonly known as the stonecress or desert stonecrop, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Brassicaceae. These plants are typically succulent, with fleshy leaves and showy flowers that range in color from white to purple. They are native to arid and semi-arid regions, particularly in the Mediterranean, North Africa, and parts of Asia. Arthrophytum species are adapted to harsh environments, storing water in their thick, fleshy stems and leaves. They play an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing food for desert wildlife.
